definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: Orion (relation to above √ obscure);—Am 5:8, Job 9:9; also [[תְּפַתֵּחַ]] ´[[משְׁכוֹת כ]] Job 38:31 the cords of Orion wilt (canst) thou let out ? (appar. some mythological allusion, v. Di Che, to giant bound in skies; cf. Hom. ’Wri/wna dokeu/ei, and sqe/hov )Wri/wnov); both times associated with the Pleiades; sf. [[כְּסִילֵיהֶם]] their Orions Is 13:10, Orion and other constellations of the same brilliancy.
